title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. II, subch. D, pt. 4814 - Commercial Lessor: Application And Licensing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. II, subch. D, pt. 4814 - Commercial Lessor: Application And Licensing

State Regulations
§ 4814.1 - Form for application
§ 4814.2 - Bingo rental statement
§ 4814.3 - Individual and business entity statement
§ 4814.4 - Corporation statement
§ 4814.6 - Requisites for license
§ 4814.7 - Hearings
§ 4814.8 - Issuance by clerk
§ 4814.9 - Disapproval procedure
§ 4814.10 - Notification of racing and wagering commission
§ 4814.11 - Grounds for revocation or suspension
§ 4814.12 - Time during which license is effective
§ 4814.13 - Limitation upon applicant for commercial license
§ 4814.14 - License form
§ 4814.15 - Establishment of maximum rentals
§ 4814.16 - Recapitulation of fees
§ 4814.17 - Interest in another commercial bingo hall prohibited
§ 4814.18 - Limitations on food concession owner and employees
[FN*] For rules regulating the conduct of bingo in leased
premises, see Part 4822 of this Chapter

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. II, subch. D, pt. 4814

Statutory authority: General Municipal Law, art. 9-A, §§ 186, 188-a; Executive Law, art. 19-B, § 435, as amd. by L. 1962, ch. 437; Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law, §§
104[1], [19], 128

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
